title: Regulations Need To Be On Sprint Along With AI, Says FM Sitharaman
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said Artificial Intelligence is not static; it is rapidly progressing, real-time and dynamic. Therefore, "all of us will have to be cautious that we do not sit back on the ethics."
content:
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said Artificial Intelligence is not static; it is rapidly progressing, real-time and dynamic. Therefore, "all of us will have to be cautious that we do not sit back on the ethics."

title: Could AI Add $2 Trillion To India’s Economy And Create Millions Of Jobs By 2035? Here's What NITI Aayog CEO Said
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) will create more jobs in India and will add nearly USD 2 trillion extra to the economy by 2035, NITI Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyam said on Monday.
content:

title: Increased adoption of AI can add USD 500-600 billion to GDP by 2035: NITI report
description: NEW DELHI, Sept 15: Accelerated adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) across industries can contribute USD 500-600 billion to India’s GDP by 2035 on the back of increased productivity and efficiency in the workforce, a NITI Aayog report said on Monday.   The report titled ‘AI for Viksit Bharat:The Opportunity for Accelerated Economic Growth’ further said over the next decade, the adoption of AI across sectors is expected to add USD 17–26 trillion to the global economy. “India’s combination of a large […]

title: NITI Aayog's 'AI for Viksit Bharat' Report Says AI could add $1Trn to India’s GDP by 2035
description: NITI Aayog’s recent report on AI, AI for Viksit Bharat, argues that artificial intelligence can be the decisive lever to help India reach an aspirational “Viksit Bharat” growth path
content:
NITI Aayog’s recent report on AI, AI for Viksit Bharat, argues that artificial intelligence can be the decisive lever to help India reach an aspirational “Viksit Bharat” growth path (roughly 8% annual GDP growth).

title: India at inflection point, has enormous opportunity to embrace AI: Tata Sons Chairman
description: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran emphasized India's pivotal moment to harness Artificial Intelligence for significant national impact. He urged collaboration between industry and government to leverage AI for skilling, job creation, and addressing inequalities in healthcare and education. Chandrasekaran advocated for integrated AI solutions across sectors to drive economic growth and prosperity.
content:

title: French AI Incubator and Sign LOI for AI Lab in Ajmer, Rajasthan
description: New Delhi [India], September 15: Adaptiv.me, a French-Tech edtech startup with roots in both India and France, and Unicraft VC, a hands-on seed fund and startup studio based in Paris and Luxembourg, have announced the launch of a pioneering Indo-French AI incubator. Alongside this milestone, the two organizations have also signed a Letter of Intent (LOI) to establish a state-of-the-art AI Lab in Ajmer, Rajasthan, positioning India as a global execution hub for next-generation artificial intelligence.

PNN

title: UPDATE 3-China says preliminary probe shows Nvidia violated anti-monopoly law
description:
China's market regulator on Monday said that a preliminary investigation had found that Nvidia had violated the country's anti-monopoly law, marking the latest hit for the U.S. chip giant.
The brief statement from the State Administration for Market Regulation did not elaborate on how the U.S. company, known for its artificial intelligence and gaming chips, might have violated China's anti-monopoly laws.

title: The Boots Bandits: How 'points thieves' are stealing loyalty card rewards from British shoppers in £300million black market
description: One in 20 Brits are said to have been affected by 'points bandits' who use artificial intelligence to generate random card numbers to eventually find a valid one.
content:
Loyalty card points are being stolen by cyber criminals in a £300million black market - with the Boots Advantage and Nectar card schemes among those being targeted.
